channel.title: Posts on Ian's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Ian's Blog

item.title: Begin building hackathon project + prepare for Harvard interview
item.description:
Last week in a nutshell:

  • Completed hackathon project, recorded demo video, cleaned up GitHub commits
  • Completed weeks 2 and 3 of Math 130
  • Met with Leo about Azure setup and discussed email generator features
  • Began researching summer job/internship opportunities
  • Created implementation plans for all CPAAutomation major items…
    • …and implemented cost efficiency improvements (removed Redis for now)
    • …and will implement performance improvements this week
      • Already implemented one (quite interesting): I saw that one user’s extraction job failed due to thousands of line items being in one document. CPAAutomation can handle this now. It turns out I can learn a lot from real users’ experiences!
  • Began laying out next phase of CPAAutomation development:
    • Strengthen authentication (email verification)
    • Team functionality (sharing)
    • Writing feature (plus RAG)
    • Integration with hackathon project (through API key)
    • Utilization of OpenClaw (agentic capabilities)

This week I want to:

item.title: Begin building hackathon project + prepare for Harvard interview
item.description:
Three time concerns:

  • Less than two weeks until hackathon deadline
    • Only two meetings with Ray until deadline
  • This coming Sunday is February 1st
    • Should meet with Leo regarding email generator
  • College app material submission
    • Counselor needs to send regular transcript to MIT
    • Counselor needs to send mid-year report to all colleges except UCs.
    • Plan to meet with her tomorrow

Today:

  • 9-10 AM: Begin phase 1 of building hackathon project (see build phases)
    • General plan: 1 phase per day
    • This leaves a few days before the deadline to test end-to-end
    • Leave Leo’s project to Saturday (lower priority)
  • 10:16 AM: Go to advisory at school
  • 12:12-12:59 AM: Lunch + prepare answers for Harvard interview
  • 2:35 PM: End of 6th period, go home
  • 3:30-4:30 PM (estimated): Doctor appointment
  • 5-6 PM (estimated): Dinner
  • 8:30–9:30 PM (estimated): Harvard interview
  • 9:30–10:30 PM: Either:
    • Continue building hackathon project according to build plan, or
    • Concretely plan how many phases to complete per day over the next 12 days

item.title: Music video, created build plans, bus to CCSF and back
item.description:
• Created music video for a “project”. Honestly it was fun.
  • Developed full implementation plans for (1) hackathon and (2) email generator
  • Took bus to CCSF to solve account issue.

Was a little tired in the evening.

item.title: LinkedIn post, MATH 130, set up repos
item.description:
• Ray made LinkedIn post. Began discussing new user acquisition.
  • Started MATH 130. Watched all lecture videos.
  • Set up local repositories for working on (1) hackathon and (2) email generator

Went to bed a little too late.

item.title: CPAAutomation Important Items
item.description:
• Created a list of important architectural improvements needed in CPAAutomation.
    • Will need to see when and how to implement these!
    • Especially important as we scale to more users.
  • Made social media posts to promote RJI Collectibles.

item.title: Recentering
item.description:
• Monday
    • Get caught up with Calc 3 Ch 12 HW
    • Read full summaries of Invisible Man (all parts), Bible (selected parts)
    • Common App revisions, send back to Ray
    • CPAAutomation Small Fixes
  • Tuesday
    • Get caught up with Calc 3 Ch 13 Text, Lectures, HW
    • Create full note sheets for Invisible Man and Bible
    • PIQ revisions
    • CPAAutomation Fix #1
  • Wednesday
    • Calc 3 Week 4 Discussion
    • Finish Biotech Project
    • CPAAutomation Fix #2
  • Thursday
    • Calc 3 Week 4 HW Submission
    • Finish Psych Project + Review Video Notes + Field Trip Form
    • CPAAutomation Fix #3
  • Friday
    • Any remaining scholarship applications
    • CPAAutomation: Any remaining work

item.title: Last week before school
item.description:
A simple plan for the last week before school.

  • Scheduling classes
    • MUST happen this week. Continue reaching out.
  • College preparation
    • Get all prompts in Word document. Write responses to all CA prompts.
  • CPAautomation.ai
    • Monday
      • Early
        • Discussion with Ray, plan out week
      • Late
        • Release preparation part 1: Non-DB changes (see Kanban)
    • Tuesday
      • Early and Late
        • Release preparation part 2: DB changes (see Kanban)
    • Wednesday
      • Early
        • Release preparation part 3: Google Workspace integration (consider moving this to after deployment as this is not immediately necessary).
      • Late
        • Deployment
    • Rest of the week: Ensure platform is working, get situated with CI/CD

item.title: Expanding my scope?
item.description:
Current Review

  1. ByteReview (might change the name). Week’s plan (refer back to original plan as well):
    1. Refactoring
    2. Multi-PDF, folders, integrations
    3. More control over templates
    4. Stripe connection
    5. Deployment
  2. College applications
    1. Stanford
      1. CA: Opens Aug 1
      2. REA: Nov 1, RD: Jan 5
      3. Decision: REA: Mid Dec, RD: Early Apr
    2. Caltech
      1. CA: Opens Aug 1
      2. REA: Nov 1, RD: Jan 5
      3. Decision: REA: Mid Dec, RD: Mid Mar
    3. UC
      1. App: Opens Aug 1
      2. Deadline: Dec 1
      3. Decision: Mar 1-31
    4. USC
      1. CA: Opens Aug 1
      2. EA (Non-B): Nov 1, RD: Jan 10
      3. Decision: EA: Mid-Late Jan, RD: Apr 1
    5. Cal Poly SLO
      1. App: Opens Oct 1
      2. Deadline: Dec 2
      3. Decision: Apr 1
  3. CB’s web scraping for legal AI project
    1. Do research on current best web scraping tools
    2. Reach back out, ask about progress and what is needed
  4. J’s Shopify add-on price monitoring idea
    1. Do research on existing tools and how to build something better
    2. Ask for websites of interest
  5. Creating a class for kids
    1. Try to find past TCS, Insp AI, Andrew Ng materials
    2. Look at Kaggle and library docs to get situated with current landscape again
  6. Project Pull
    1. Threw it out the window.
  7. Volunteering
    1. Check Mission Bit again.
  8. Driving
    1. See if worth starting now or not.

Purposes

item.title: Presented working app. MongoDB? PostgreSQL?
item.description:
Upload, extraction, export working.

Field names, data types, prompts working.

Refactoring to be done to make codebase organized and scalable, then more features.

(Thinking about switching to MongoDB or PostgreSQL. Not sure yet.)

item.title: Next.js, FastAPI, Firebase, Gemini...
item.description: June 30 - July 5: Did not blog during this period. Spent time learning Next.js, FastAPI, Firebase, Gemini. Getting situated with project again.

item.title: Meeting with Ray, discussed new plan
item.description: Recovering from jetlag. Will be using Gemini API.

item.title: Last day before trip
item.description: Back from trip. Mind-blowing. Many pictures.

item.title: Last day before trip
item.description: Finalized project plan - no working prototype yet. Packing for trip.

item.title: Creating a plan - need something solid before Sunday
item.description:
Morning

  1. Get Firebase, Google Cloud Storage, Document AI connected
  2. Do any necessary refactoring

Afternoon

  1. Build working code to connect with APIs
  2. At minimum: Upload a file, be able to view returned output when processing is finished
  3. Alpha version goal (by Sunday): Be able to upload a file, then after processing is finished, click to open results with PDF preview on one side and editable fields on the other side. Approve button and Export to CSV button.
  4. Create document with full project plan and screenshots of current build, send Google Docs link to Ray Sang

Evening

item.title: Building foundation of app... firm foundation or not?
item.description:
Scaffolded Extractly, not sure how much to focus on perfecting structure vs. getting something working

Read lots of docs, slightly confused about how to specify columns to extract and how to provide prompts

Determined to move forward - said I would get something working, will get something working by end of week

item.title: Getting into it
item.description:
Morning

  1. Look for volunteer opportunities (start by contacting robotics team)

Afternoon

  1. Put college list in Excel, make info complete (add application fees), lay out essay doc
  2. List majors interested in, info about them (figure out columns), what jobs come from them

Evening

  1. Hopefully got a response from RS - more details about project?
    1. If so, figure out tech needed for project and start learning it
    2. If not, figure out tech needed for own project and start learning it
  2. Then use figma, ppt, or both to lay it out

item.title: First Post
item.description:
First day: Thu 5/29 (just nighttime)

Second day: Fri 5/30 (new K restaurant + walking around)

First festival, lots of people…

Still pushing through caffeine withdrawal.

Plan for tomorrow (might have to split over multiple days):

Morning

  1. Write and send rec letter email
  2. Start making list of colleges, location, tuition, top majors by quality, top majors by personal preference, essay questions

Afternoon

  1. Reach out to Ray Sang
  2. Contact robotics team + find other teaching or volunteer opportunities

Evening
